CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Senior Technical Sales & Services Engineer, Topsoe, Manama  
O C T O B E R 2 0 1 8 — P R E S E N T  
 
● Preparing catalyst performance estimates and complex technical  
proposals in response to customer requests covering naphtha, kerosene,  
diesel and VGO hydrotreating. The proposals are for both catalyst  
replacements and grass root technology sales.  
● Defending our technical proposals in response to queries from refinery  
customers as well as engineering design firms and internal  
hydroprocessing process licensing and engineering teams.  
● Identifying and developing opportunities by means of highlighting value  
propositions derived from usin g Topsoe's technical offerings.  
● Supporting customers through the catalyst loading, activation and start - 
up process.  
● Supporting customer’s hydrotreating and hydrocracking unit operations  
through analysis of data and assistance in troubleshooting efforts.  
● Using and improving catalyst performance models as a tool to support  
the catalyst business.  
● Documenting successes that customers achieve with Topsoe catalysts  
and technical support and sharing knowledge gained from these  
successes within the organization, helping to further strength en 
Topsoe's technical and commercial positions.  
● Building positive working relationships with customer's technical staff,  
 
   
achieving a position of trusted advisor with the customer.  
● Supporting and mentoring junior TSE staff members.  
● Supporting the sale s staff by providing commercial insights on customer  
needs and drivers.  
 
 
Process Design Engineer, Honeywell UOP, Gurgaon  
M A R C H 2 0 1 7 — O C T O B E R 2 0 1 8  
 
● Front -end engineering for UOP -licensed hydroprocessing units.  
● Generation of PFDs, PIDs, MSD etc, for new and revamped units.  
● Preparation of engineering design specifications for equipment such as  
heat exchangers, pumps, compressors, vessels etc as a part of the UOP  
Schedule A package.  
● Process unit hydraulic cal culations and tabulations.  
● Estimation and calculation of plant or complex -wide utility consumption.  
Generation of flare load summaries, PSV specifications and relief load  
calculations.  
● Quality management by assuring project specifications meet the high est 
of customer standards.  
● Development of technical proposals and preliminary engineering design  
data for bids in support of the technical sales team.  
● Troubleshooting and addressing customer engineering issues and  
queries concerning units licensed by UOP.  
● Perform economic a nd feasibility studies for plant flow and equipment  
configurations to justify tailor -made engineered process solutions for  
customers.  
 
 
Assistant Manager & Production Engineer , Indian Oil Corporation  
Limited, Haldia  
A U G U S T 2 0 1 0 — M A R C H 2 0 1 7  
 
● Shift Incharge engineer for naphtha hydrotreating, kerosene  
desulphurisation, catalytic reforming, crude distillation and hydrogen  
generation units of IOCL’s Haldia Refinery.  
● Planning, managing and monitoring unit operations to tackle issues  
related to operating parameters, product quality, breakdowns etc.  
● Development and implementation of incremental process  
improvements to improve GRM, product quality and lower energy &  
utility consumption.  
● Participation and collaboration with process licensors in undertaking  
plant PGTRs for evaluating and optimizing equipment performance,  
catalyst run lengths and minimizing quality giveaways.  
● Involved in particular activities related to catalytic units s uch as reactor  
internals installation, inspection, catalyst loading, regeneration, sulfiding  
and startups.  
 
   
● Process equipment such as vessels, columns, heat exchangers, and  
heaters, checkout and inspection during turnarounds.  
● Handling process plant emer gencies like power, steam, cooling water  
equipment failure, unit upsets, fires, etc., by taking requisite actions.  
● Writing and updating plant operating manuals and equipment -specific  
procedures.  
● Mentoring and training new plant operators, engineers and  trainees.  
 
 
COMMENT  
Result -oriented, fast -moving, energetic and tacit chemical engineer with  
more than twelve years of professional experience covering refinery  
operations, process engineering, technical services, catalyst sales and proc ess 
technology licensing.
